# Words that stand in for other words

---

# All about pronouns

.Large[
- A word that substitutes a noun or noun phrase
]

### .center[Ana moved the chair and found $5 under it.]

--

.Large[
- All languages have pronouns

### .center[Ellos fueron al cine y se encontraron con nosotros.]
]

--

.Large[
- We *think* approx. 40% of languages have gendered pronouns
]

---

# All about pronouns

.Large[
- Not just personal pronouns
  - reflexive pronouns (e.g., self)
  - indefinite pronouns (e.g., anyone, someone)
  - demonstrative pronouns (e.g., this, that, these, those)
  - interrogative pronouns (e.g., who, where)
]

--

.Large[
- Not just a single word
  - reciprocal pronouns (e.g., one another)
  - emphatic reflexives (e.g., I myself)
  - idiomatic compounds (e.g., Everyone and their mom)
  - dismissive compounds (e.g., Keep it up and they might fire *your ass*)
]

---

# All about pronouns

.Large[
- Pronouns can change
  - thou > you
  - vuestra merced > usted
]

--

.Large[
- Pronouns can vary
  - you all, y'all, yinz, you guys, youse guys
  - t√∫, vos, vosotros, ustedes
]

--

.Large[
- Pronouns are hard
  - L1 acquisition (case)
  - Theory of mind
  - L2 acquisition
]
